answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
In Milwaukee, the Milwaukee Economic Development Corporation Capital Access Program uses a loan loss reserve.
http://city.milwaukee.gov/BusinessToolbox.htm#Tools1
Seattle also passed an economic development plan that incorporated a loan loss reserve.
http://clerk.ci.seattle.wa.us/~scripts/nph-brs.exe?s1=&s3=116961&s4=&s2=&s5=&Sect4=AND&l=20&Sect2=THESON&Sect3=PLURON&Sect5=CBORY&Sect6=HITOFF&d=ORDF&p=1&u=%2F~public%2Fcbory.htm&
I also included a press release about the bill.
http://www.seattle.gov/economicdevelopment/pdf_files/Energy%20Efficiency%20Grant%20OED%20Acceptance%20Release%20final%2010-4-10.pdf
The City of Yakima, WA passed a successful Economic Development Initiative in 2002 that involved a loan loss reserve.
http://www.hud.gov/offices/cpd/economicdevelopment/programs/rc/tour/wa/yakima/gs1.cfm
Gulfport, MS also offers a Capital Access Loan Loss Reserve for businesses.
http://www.gulfport-ms.gov/taxincentives.shtml
Below is a sample ordinance from Wichita, KS for a loan loss reserve program.
http://www.wichita.gov/NR/rdonlyres/7F288F53-FB3F-40DA-A5B6-8C160455714A/0/Ordinance_No_45945.pdf
You can read more about the Michigan s Capital Access Program which includes loan loss reserves in this article from the W. E. Upjohn Institute for Employment Research.
http://www.upjohn.org/publications/wp/95-33.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Toni Shope
text:
An Alliance member is looking for examples of best practices in other communities for gap financing programs.
These would be economic development programs where City's provide a loan loss reserve to encourage private investment or actually loan funds to businesses.
Thank you for your help.
title: Gap Financing Programs
